title: What are some examples of positive feedback systems? - Quora

response.answer_text: We should try to bring out the best in everyone we meet - so they feel good about themselves. Accentuate the positive about the student - either their work, line of thought - or in fact anything else that may be appreciated. If we make people sense that they can let down their defence safely they may risk letting out their creativity and be much more open - and in the end much more nice and rewarding to be around. We might even say: treat everyone as you would like to be treated.

Just to be absolutely clear, “positive” feedback identifies something you’ve done “right:” “I appreciate the clarity of your question.” “Constructive” feedback is intended to help you improve your work: “You might want to distinguish between positive and constructive feedback.” Some negative feedback can be constructive: “I don’t have enough information to answer your question.” I hope this helps. I also hope it’s not an example of “Too much information!”
